required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Connectivity In Relation To Proprioception and Sensorimotor Recovery in Stroke Patients (Feasibility Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Functional Connectivity In Relation To Proprioception and Sensorimotor Recovery in Stroke Patients (Feasibility Study)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose now is to:
1. identify brain connections related to proprioception to have a better understanding of differences between people with stroke and healthy persons
2. evaluate how these brain connections will change in people with stroke when they are engaged in a 6-week neurocognitive therapeutic program.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the usability of the robot
primary_outcome.description: The robots will be used for research in healthy adults and stroke patients in the proposed studies below. The robots have been tested and cleared by the 3T safety committee at the CMRR, U of M. The first objective is a feasibility study to repeat the exercises with the robot in the 3T scanner at the U of M in 3 healthy adults and 3 individuals with stroke. The individuals with stroke will receive 6 weeks of therapy.

arm_group.description: The treatment group will receive the neurocognitive therapeutic approach that uses motor imagery and sensory discrimination exercises
inactive transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) treatment

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
